channel.title: [TUT]Adding/Deleting object's in Project Insanity Sourced Server's
channel.description:
Okay here goes... This took me forever to find out (and i searched for a very long time!) so please, if I have done something wrong or different to how you did, please dont flame me, just let me know and i will edit/add it into tut
Go into your Server folder > src > Server > World
Then open up ObjectManager.java
Then press CTRL+F and search for this: [code]public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c)[/code] Underneath it you should find some of the custom objects which whoever u got ur "Base Source" from has put in for example: Some Bank Booth's at Home
Underneath what is already there, put in this: [code] c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(ItemID, PosX, PosY, 1, 10);[/code] Obviously change: ItemID for the Item ID of the thing u want to have there (Bank booth ID is 2213) PosX for the "X" Co-ordinate of where u want the item to be. PosY for the "Y" Co-ordinate of where u want the item to be. //THESE CAN BE FOUND OUT BY GOING TO WHEREVER IT IS THAT U WANT THE ITEM TO BE AND TYPING ::MYPOS The next number 1 can be changed to a 2, depending on which way u want the item to be facing [u][b]LEAVE THE NUMBER 10 ALONE! DO NOT TOUCH![/b][/u] (unless u know what its for lol)
So an example would be, if i wanted a Bank Booth to face towards edgeville wildy in the middle of the "Prayer Guild" i would put this code:
[code] c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2213, 3048, 3488, 2, 10);[/code] And thats it! Save, Compile and Run your server!
If you found this Tutorial Helpful in any way, please rep++ Many Thanks [b][u]Fluoxetine[/u][/b]
P.S. If this TUT is in the wrong section, please could a member of staff move it. Thanks again!

item.title: [TUT]Adding/Deleting object's in Project Insanity Sourced Server's
item.dc:creator: @znick55 znick55
item.description:
@znick55 wrote:

Your tutorial is crap…

Btw you didnt even explain how to delete them even though its in the title?

Anyways here is how to delete an object(simple way)
Put this in with the rest of the spawning objects.

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(-1, Xcord, Ycord, 1, 10);

So basicly find the objects x and y cords and place them in the above line of code.
Leave the -1, without the -1 it wont delete anything.

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT]Adding/Deleting object's in Project Insanity Sourced Server's

So GF, and GTFO my topic

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]Adding/Deleting object's in Project Insanity Sourced Server's
item.dc:creator: @Fluoxetine Fluoxetine
item.description:
@Fluoxetine wrote:

Okay here goes… This took me forever to find out (and i searched for a very long time!) so please, if I have done something wrong or different to how you did, please dont flame me, just let me know and i will edit/add it into tut

Go into your Server folder > src > Server > World

Then open up ObjectManager.java

Then press CTRL+F and search for this:

public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c)

Underneath it you should find some of the custom objects which whoever u got ur “Base Source” from has put in for example: Some Bank Booth’s at Home

Underneath what is already there, put in this:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(ItemID, PosX, PosY, 1, 10); Obviously change:
ItemID for the Item ID of the thing u want to have there (Bank booth ID is 2213)
PosX for the “X” Co-ordinate of where u want the item to be.
PosY for the “Y” Co-ordinate of where u want the item to be. //THESE CAN BE FOUND OUT BY GOING TO WHEREVER IT IS THAT U WANT THE ITEM TO BE AND TYPING ::MYPOS
The next number 1 can be changed to a 2, depending on which way u want the item to be facing
LEAVE THE NUMBER 10 ALONE! DO NOT TOUCH! (unless u know what its for lol)

So an example would be, if i wanted a Bank Booth to face towards edgeville wildy in the middle of the “Prayer Guild” i would put this code:

                c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2213, 3048, 3488, 2, 10);

And thats it! Save, Compile and Run your server!

If you found this Tutorial Helpful in any way, please rep++
Many Thanks
Fluoxetine

P.S. If this TUT is in the wrong section, please could a member of staff move it. Thanks again!

Read full topic
